data.title: Clique of clansmen shields arrogant Assad from reality
data.meta_description: President Assad of Syria, shielded from reality by a tight clique of about 30 clansmen, spooks and soldiers, is in no hurry to surrender or share power.He is convinced that he is negotiating in
data.text:
President Assad of Syria, shielded from reality by a tight clique of about 30 clansmen, spooks and soldiers, is in no hurry to surrender or share power.

He is convinced that he is negotiating in Geneva from a position of strength. “His army is stronger, his allies are more committed and the regime’s capacity for brutality has kept it in charge,” says a leading Syria commentator, Joshua Landis, director of the Centre of Middle East Studies at the University of Oklahoma.

The challenge for the peace-makers at Geneva — made all too clear by the purposeful stalling of the Syrian Government team yesterday — is to persuade Mr Assad that his time is up. Personal interventions with the mistrustful leader have not worked. “Over the
